task.title: Defining the server preferences
task.shortdesc: Using the Preferences page, you can define attributes used for testing projects by the servers. To define these preferences, complete the following:

keywords.indexterm: serversdefining preferencessetting publishing preferencessetting timeout delays

step.cmd: In the toolbar, select Window Preferences.
In the Preferences page, select Server.
Specify one or more of the following settings by selecting the appropriate check box:

chrow.choption: Show Servers view when server state changes
chrow.chdesc: The Servers view is displayed on the workbench when there are any activities in the Servers view. For more details about the server states refer to the Servers View topic.

chrow.choption: Synchronize servers on workbench startupcontext id = spge0028
chrow.chdesc: Review descriptionThis option specifies that each time you start the workbench, it will try to update the status of the server defined in the Servers view with the actual state of the server, such as Started or Stopped.

Specifies that all the files should automatically be published to the local server at every seconds intervals, where seconds is the number of seconds you have specified in the Publishing interval (in seconds) control. The minimum value for the publishing interval is ten seconds.

Specifies that all the files should automatically be published to the remote server at every seconds intervals, where seconds is the number of seconds you have specified in the Publishing interval (in seconds) control. The minimum value for the publishing interval is ten seconds.

chrow.choption: Prompt before making irreversible changes within an editor
chrow.chdesc: Specifies that the server tools will prompt you before you make a change in a editor that cannot be undone.

step.cmd: Under the Server timeout delay drop-down list, select one of the following relative length of time you can wait before ending a server operation:

info.note: If you have a fast processing machine, you can try using the Shorter timeout delay option. If you have a slow processing machine, you can try using the Longer timeout delay option.

step.cmd: Click Apply and then OK to save your changes.
